creator: paul@ensigma.com.au
text:
I have a GDBM authentication file that works correctly in 2.0.59.

When I use 2.2.4 I get the following error:

(70023)This function has not been implemented on this platform: could not open 
dbm (type GDBM) auth file: /etc/httpd/conf/users

the 2.2.4 version of dbmmanage can read the users file as expected.

That error just means you (or whoever built your system) compiled APR-UTIL without GDBM support.

Please use a user support forum for questions of this kind.
creator: nick@webthing.com
paul@ensigma.com.au
text: Does this explain why 2.0.59 works fine?

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Does this explain why 2.0.59 works fine?

Yes, as your 2.0.59 simply seems to have been build with GDBM support. Add
--with-gdbm to your configure call and rebuild 2.2.4.

creator: paul@ensigma.com.au
text:
I did! And therein lies what I believe to be the bug. I should have been more
explicit in my original post but, the configure line for both was:

./configure --enable-mods-shared=all --enable-authz-dbm --enable-authn-dbm
--with-gdbm --enable-speling=shared --with-ssl --enable-ssl --enable-deflate

I added the enable-auth?-dbm bits when it didn't work. Before that I had:

./configure --enable-mods-shared=all --enable-auth-dbm --with-gdbm
--enable-speling=shared --with-ssl --enable-ssl --enable-deflate

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
Comment #3 is slightly misleading, as it's APR-UTIL that needs gdbm support, and
you just rebuilt HTTPD.

creator: paul@ensigma.com.au
text: Does this still make it curious that 2.0 works and 2.2 doesn't?

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> Does this still make it curious that 2.0 works and 2.2 doesn't?

Yes.  Apache 2.0 used APR-0.9.  Apache 2.2 uses APR-1.x (1.2.x preferred;
earlier 1.x will build just fine but without the latest goodies).  Your 0.9
build includes GDBM; your 1.x build doesn't.
